actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to allow Federal law enforcement officers and firefighters who are 55 years of age and have completed 5 years of service the benefits of immediate retirement under section 8336(c) of title 5, United States Code.

summary.text: Grants a Civil Service annuity to any Federal employee who is separated from the service: (1) after becoming 50 years of age and completing 20 years of service as a law enforcement officer or firefighter (or any combination of such service totaling at least 20 years); or (2) after becoming 55 years of age and completing 5 years of service as a law enforcement officer or firefighter (or any combination of such service totaling at least 5 years).

titles.title: A bill to allow Federal law enforcement officers and firefighters who are 55 years of age and have completed 5 years of service the benefits of immediate retirement under section 8336(c) of title 5, United States Code.
